授業目的: The course will give students an introduction into regional economic integration and will analyze the effects on national economic development. Students will both learn about the positive aspects of economic integration, but also why regional economic integration is not proceeding at the moment, which obstacles it meets (not just in the EU), despite the obvious advantages and gains in overall wealth creation.
到達目標:
Students are expected to acquire profound knowledge of various organizations pursuing regional economic integration and develop analytical skills to interpret the effects of integrating economic activities across borders.
Evaluation of students' performance will be based on: 60% participation and contribution to the course and 40% final student presentation
関連科目: All management and economy related courses of the EUIJ certificate program (enrollment in the program required in order to attend courses at Kobe and Osaka Universities)
授業方法:
Face-to-face lecture.
PPP presentation and class discussion; the course follows a seminar approach

第1回:
Introduction: Why does regional economic integration matter?
All classes are face to face
第2回: Regional economic integration from a historical perspective: The Latin monetary union and its failure
第6回: The EU and free trade agreements: From CETA with Canada to EPA with Japan
第7回: Regional economic integration in North America (NAFTA)
第8回: Regional economic integration in North America (USMCA)
第11回: Mercosur: Regional economic cooperation in middle and south America
第12回: The Arab Maghreb Union: Prospects of a North African economic integration
第13回: African Union (AU) and Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC)
第14回: Possibility of an East Asian Community?
トピック.授業外学習2: Students are expected to gain a broad overview over the existing research on regional economic integration by selective reading (guidance will be given in class)
